sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
An account of the proceeding to sentence against Miles Prance, for wilful perjury who was sentenced in the Court of King's-Bench, Westminster: upon a conviction, by his own confession, on the 15th. of June, 1686. In wilfully forswearing himself at the tryals of Robert Green, Lawrence Hill, and Henry Berry, &c in relation to the murther of Sir Edmundbury Godfrey. Prance, Miles, fl. 1678-1689. England and Wales. Court of King's Bench.
1 sheet (2 p.)
printed for A.M., London : 1686.
At foot of text: This may be printed, R.P. June 25. 1686. Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
=======
An account of the proceeding to sentence against Miles Prance, for wilful perjury who was sentenced in the Court of King's-Bench, Westminster: upon a conviction, by his own confession, on the 15th. of June, 1686. In wilfully forswearing himself at the tryals of Robert Green, Lawrence Hill, and Henry Berry, &c in relation to the murther of Sir Edmundbury Godfrey. Prance, Miles, fl. 1678-1689. England and Wales. Court of King's Bench.
1 sheet (2 p.)
printed for A.M., London : 1686.
